abstract.text: Perform common linear algebra operations with Apple’s implementation of the Basic Linear Algebra Subprograms (BLAS).

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The vecLib framework contains nine C header files (not counting
This document describes the functions declared in the header files
, which contain the interfaces for Apple’s implementation of the BLAS API.

Note that documentation describing the leading dimension as the first dimension of a matrix refers to column-major ordering. In row-major ordering, the leading dimension is the second dimension of a matrix.

Apple provides the BLAS and LAPACK libraries under the Accelerate framework to be in line with LAPACK 3.9.1. Starting with iOS 19, iPadOS 19, macOS 16, tvOS 19, watchOS 19, and visionOS 3, the libraries are in line with LAPACK 3.12.0. These new interfaces provide additional functionality, as well as a new ILP64 interface. To use the new interfaces, define
before including the Accelerate or vecLib headers. For ILP64 interfaces, also define
as preprocessor macros in Xcode build settings.

abstract.text: Use LAPACK to solve a linear system and find an interpolating polynomial to construct new points between a series of known data points.

doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation.title: Finding an interpolating polynomial using the Vandermonde method

abstract.text: Manage and work with the properties of a sparse matrix.
An updated BLAS interface supporting ILP64 is available.
Perform computations with matrices and vectors.
Create, insert values into, and extract values from a pointwise sparse matrix.
Select the optimal LAPACK routine to solve a system of linear equations.

doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation.title: Solving systems of linear equations with LAPACK

abstract.text: Create and work with sparse vector structures.

inlineContent.text: The types given here are valid for C or C++ and for either PowerPC or Intel processors.   The typedefs shown are for C++ and PowerPC processors; for other, conditionally compiled typedefs, see the header files.
